intro: Picramnia tenuis, commonly known as the slender picramnia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is a small shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. The botanical features of Picramnia tenuis make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
